Module kivakit.resource
Package com.telenav.kivakit.resource.compression.archive

Class ZipArchive

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
com.telenav.kivakit.resource.compression.archive.ZipArchive
All Implemented Interfaces:
Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver, ByteSized, Receiver, Transmitter, NamedObject, AutoCloseable, Iterable<ZipEntry>
public final class ZipArchive extends BaseRepeater implements Iterable<ZipEntry>, AutoCloseable, ByteSized
A wrapper around the JDK zip filesystem that makes it easier to use. A ZipArchive can be created with open(Listener, File, Mode), which returns the open zip archive or null if the operation fails. Adds the ability to save and load objects into zip entries using an ObjectWriter, and ObjectReader, respectively. A zip archive contains entries wrapped by ZipEntry and a ZipArchive is Iterable to make it easy to enumerate zip entries: 
 var archive = new ZipArchive("test.zip");
 for (var entry : archive)
 {
     System.out.println(entry);
 }

Adding Files

Files can be added to the archive with add(List, ProgressReporter). To do this, the zip file must be opened in ZipArchive.Mode.WRITE.

Saving

  • save(String, Resource) - Saves the given resources into the named zip entry
  • save(ObjectWriter, String, VersionedObject) - Writes the object to the given entry
  • saveEntry(String, Callback) - Saves to the named entry calling the callback to do the work

Loading

  • load(ObjectReader, String) - Loads the object from the named entry using the given serializer
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
See Also:
ZipEntry, ProgressReporter, ObjectReader, ObjectWriter, Resource

    • entry

      public ZipEntry entry​(String pathname)
      If the archive resource is a file, uses ZipFile to access the zip entry directly. Otherwise, resorts to scanning the entire input stream for the entry.
      Returns:
      The entry, if any, for the given name
